just took a poop off the side of the
little rock over here
they're amazing the wildlife on these
islands steal your heart and your time
with them becomes quickly some of your
best

where man and wildlife live in harmony
it's truly a beautiful sight to see I'm

there are several places on the islands

Tortoises and if you're lucky even
become one yourself I am walking in the
wild and there are wild tortoises
everywhere some of them are huge what's
really cool about them is they're
endemic these species of tortoises are
endemic to the Galapagos and actually
Galapagos means tortoise so that's why
they named these islands after them
there are 11 types of tortoises that are
endemic to the Galapagos and the
difference between endemic and native
that I just learned is endemic means
they're from here they were here before
the Galapagos became the Galapagos and
they cannot be found these types of
species anywhere else in the world
native means that the animals mammals
they were brought they were brought here
or they came here after the Galapagos
became the Galapagos and they have made
this now their home but you can find
them in other parts of the world just
like a lot of the wildlife here in the
Galapagos there are a lot of plants that
are endemic to the islands meaning that
they're only found here one of them is
the s Galatia tree which is really
important super cool - it can grow up to
21 metres high and it's really important
to the island because during the dry
season I sometimes I get only a little
bit drizzle of rain and this tree has
moss that grows to the top of it and it
collects that little bit of rain and
disperses it to the other trees and
plants below so that they can continue
to grow it's also food for a lot of the
wildlife so it's a pretty important tree
here in the Galapagos this tree here I
